AbstractRange.summary: The AbstractRange abstract interface is the base class upon which all DOM range types are defined. A range is an object that indicates the start and end points of a section of content within the document.

blockquote.para: As an abstract interface, you will not directly instantiate an object of type AbstractRange. Instead, you will use the or interfaces. To understand the difference between those two interfaces, and how to choose which is appropriate for your needs, consult each interface's documentation.

AbstractRangeEndContainer.summary: The read-only endContainer property of the interface returns the in which the end of the range is located.
AbstractRangeEndContainer.value: The which contains the last character of the range.

AbstractRangeStartContainer.summary: The read-only startContainer property of the interface returns the start for the range.
AbstractRangeStartContainer.value: The inside which the start position of the range is found.

AbstractRangeEndOffset.summary: The endOffset property of the interface returns the offset into the end node of the range's end position.
AbstractRangeEndOffset.value: An integer value indicating the number of characters into the indicated by at which the final character of the range is located.

AbstractRangeCollapsed.summary: The read-only collapsed property of the interface returns true if the range's start position and end position are the same.
AbstractRangeCollapsed.value: A boolean value which is true if the range is collapsed. A collapsed range is one in which the start and end positions are the same, resulting in a zero-character-long range.

AbstractRangeStartOffset.summary: The read-only startOffset property of the interface returns the offset into the start node of the range's start position.
AbstractRangeStartOffset.value: An integer value indicating the number of characters into the indicated by at which the first character of the range is located.
